variant.question: A line on a chart joining places of equal sea level pressure is called an:
An isothermal layer is a layer of air in which the temperature...

options.text: may increase or decrease at irregular intervals.
increases with height at a constant rate.
decreases with height at a constant rate.

variant.question: An isothermal layer is a layer of air..

options.text: in which the lapse rate is zero.
in which isotherms in a horizontal plane all run parallel and are equidistant.
in which there is no horizontal temperature gradient.
which is thermally insulated, i.e. which has no heat exchange with its environment.

How may the correct wind speed be found, for a level, which is between two upper air chart levels? (e.gwind at FL250, when the 500 hPa and the 300 hPa chart are available).

options.text: By interpolation of the wind information available from the two charts, while also considering the maximum wind information found on the Significant Weather Chart.
By reading wind direction and speed from the 300 hPa chart.
By simple interpolation of wind information available from the two charts.
By reading wind direction and speed from the next higher chart.
